intro: Anthemis tubaeformis, commonly known as the tansy or golden tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are deeply lobed and aromatic, while the bright yellow flowers bloom in summer. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered invasive in certain regions.
